Title: Sinai Arabic 460. Lives of Saints and Martyrdoms : manuscript, [10th c.]. St. Catherine's Monastery, Sinai, Egypt
Contents note: Life of St. Gregory the Illuminator, father of Armenian Christianity ; Martydom of SS. Febronia, Babylianus the Bishop and his three young companions, Sibyllianus and his sister Dorothea, and Petracius and Cyprus - the last two in the reign of Julian the Apostate ; Stories of Clement the Pupil of St. Peter, Xenophon and his wife Maria and their children John and Arcadius ; Some sayings of Saints John Chrysostom and Jacob the Pious Bishop of Butnan Surug ; Prayer to be said in case of drought or fear

Title: Sinai Arabic 520. Martyrdoms and Lives of Saints ; Mimars : manuscript, [10th c.]. St. Catherine's Monastery, Sinai, Egypt
Contents note: Ancient Codex containing ten treatises which may be classified In the following categories: 1 - Mimar by St. John Chrysostom on observing Mass. 2 - Theological treatise by St. Michael Patriarch of Nicaea. 3 - Stories 1 of St. Mary the Maccabean and her seven children, of St. John Chrysostom, of St. Ephraem, and of SS. Cosmas and Damian. 4 - Martyrdom of SS. Victor and Stephan during Decius’ reign in Egypt and of Apimechu of Pelusium in Alexandria at the hands of Julian. 5 - An expose of the sack of Jerusalem and the capture of the Holy Cross of the Passion together with Zacharias the Patriarch by the Persians

Title: Sinai Arabic 535. Martyrdoms and Lives of Saints ; Mimars : manuscript, [13th c.]. St. Catherine's Monastery, Sinai, Egypt
Author: Anṭākī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Faḍl, -approximately 1052|~|John, of Damascus, Saint|~|John Chrysostom, Saint, -407|~|Andrew, of Crete, Saint, approximately 660-740
Contents note: Codex containing twenty-four miscellaneous Lives of Saints, Mimars, Martyrdoms, and other subjects, divisible into the following categories: 1 - Mimars by SS. John Damascene and John Chrysostom. 2- Encomium by St. Andrew Bishop of Crete and another by Bishop Abdallah ibn al-Fadl addressed to St. Nicolaus, a thrid by St. Pericles Patriarch of Constantinople to St. Stephens first martyr, and an anonymous elegy. 3 - Lives of Saints and Martyrdoms including those of SS. Peter Patriarch of Alexandria, Jeremiah, al-Harith of Nagran and his companions, Jacob the Apostle, Athanasius of Al-Qulzum, Sergius and Bacchus, Theodorus, Mercurius, Procopius, Panteleemon, Agathangelus, Demetrius and his pupil Nestor, Eustratius, Auxentius, Eugenius, Aristus, Mardarius, the forty martyrs of Sebastia, Eustace together with his wife and two children, Euclid and Joseph the Jew. 4 - Book of the Nativity of Our Lady by Jacob the Apostle

Title: Sinai Arabic 702. Varia : manuscript, 1421. St. Catherine's Monastery, Sinai, Egypt
